website_summaries.verdict: The Sennheiser RS 220 is one of the best-sounding wireless headphones on the market, but its super sonics don't offset its ambitious price tag when other models in the same line offer similar performance for less.
pros: The Sennheiser RS 220 is a large, full-size headphone that uses advanced DSSS lossless wireless technology for exceptional sound quality
cons: The RS 220's shiny black plastic construction doesn't jive with its lofty price tag and the digital connection doesn't work with Dolby or DTS audio signals

customer_reviews.title: Best headphone
customer_reviews.text: I used it to watch TV almost every night in the past seven years; great sound quality, and very comfortable. Unfortunately it gave up on me today. Since it’s discontinued, I don’t want to buy another one. Now I’m on the fence for RS195.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Defective produce discovered too late to return
customer_reviews.text: After you place the headphones onto the charger/storage stand, you must monitor to see when the charge is complete and then use them immediately or they will lose the charge. If you place them on the stand and then come back to use them a week later, they will already be near dead, so you'll get only a few minutes of use before they stop working. Unfortunately, it took me a little over a month to discover this, and Amazon refused to accept return, even though they were defective. If you buy these, test them extensively very quickly so you can discover defects in time to return them. Don't get stuck like I did.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Hatch

customer_reviews.title: I can hear the breathing of the person playing the Cello!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are very good wireless headphones, high Quality! I hooked them up to my old sony google tv with optical connection loaded Pandora and i was in love with the sound!!!! Yes the reviews say other wise, but sometimes with wireless stuff you have to try it for yourself. I took a chance on these and it paid off!. Plus Amazon is so uber awesome with customer service if you dont like something you can send it back before 30 days. WIN WIN!! thanks Amazon!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfection!!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why people are having issues with these, they are perfect. They operate as they are supposed to and the sound is incredible. I use them with new samsung tv and only when I switch to built in apps such as netflix ect do I lose sound. But no matter as with a touch of the button I have sound. Analog is fantastic anyway so no matter. Referring to optical in last statement. As for distance, I live in single family home and have it set up in my basement, I can walk upstairs throughout home with no drop offs. Won't give these up!!
customer_reviews.author: James Artinghelli

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete digital audio decode
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound great but if you're using either the coaxial or optical digital inputs it only decodes 2.0 (stereo) not 5.1. This means they won't work with most high end television sets. In order to get them to work you have to spend another $100 for a 5.1 digital to stereo converter box.
customer_reviews.author: neonglass

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Wireless Headphones
customer_reviews.text: These headphones have excellent sound and the range reaches everywhere in our 1600 sq. ft. house. What I really like about these is the multiple inputs for analog, optical, and coaxial digital. This is the third set of Sennheiser wireless headphones that I own. I have no criticism for this set of headphones.
customer_reviews.author: the Goffster

customer_reviews.title: Best wireless headphones that I have owned!
customer_reviews.text: By far the best sounding Wireless headphone. It is also nice that I have multiple sources plugged into it and can change from the headset. Distance isn't quite what it says, but I could go 60+ feet from the receiver in my house. If i needed more I would listen somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: coyote17007

customer_reviews.title: A amazing
customer_reviews.text: Shut the front door I cannot say enough about these headphones just get them and don't forget to buy the optical cord and take off the red caps they will fit!!!
customer_reviews.author: LEM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Choice!
customer_reviews.text: As a musician, the wireless Sennheiser allows me free roam of my studio to work on my keyboards, guitars, bass and drums without any interruption in the incredible sound. The sound presented is crystal clear and picks up the ranges without distortion. My highest recommendation for these headphones!
customer_reviews.author: Molly King

customer_reviews.title: Terrible interference ruins an otherwise lovely product.
customer_reviews.text: Fit great, feel great, sound great - until the cut-outs start. I moved them to my bedroom where there is less interference and they work better, but still, for the price these should work much, much, much better.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer61739

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser
customer_reviews.text: This headphone is amazing. I had some others in the past but this one is defenetly the most clean on sound and back ground noises. I can't say a bad thing about it. I would defenetly recommend it to anyone who's willing to pay a bit more then average and want the best quality.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Hotoran

customer_reviews.title: If you need mobility, don't buy these
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is excellent; however, sound drop off is a huge problem, as soon as you move into another room. The transmission distance is very limited and I will be returning these.
customer_reviews.author: Basenji

customer_reviews.title: No longer works & Sennheiser won't repair it
customer_reviews.text: I loved my RS 220 until the transmitter base and headphones quit pairing. I followed Sennheiser's instructions for re-pairing them, with no success, and then was told by tech support to return them for servicing. But when I went on Sennheiser's website to get a service order, I learned that “Out of warranty repair is not available for this product." I paid $600 for the RS 220 headphones and am not at all happy that they cannot be repaired. Both the base and headphones turn on, and I don't know which one is causing the problem. But if anyone can use either or both, I will be happy to send it/them to you.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie

customer_reviews.title: Im vary happy with them
customer_reviews.text: I'm vary happy with them they work great. Good sound and great volume. I can walk threw out the house and still hear everything that is being said on the TV.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald P. Huppert

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking for an upgrade in performance from the RS180 which works well. The RCA Audio input works about the same as the RS180, but the optical input does not work at all. Tech support suggested that I select the optical input on the front panel. Duh... The optical input does not work at all with the optical input selected. I complained Amazon and they sent me another unit; however, I still have the same issue with the optical input. I will be returning both unit and may get another RS180. My isssue is not with Amazon, they are great in customer support. It is Sennheiser who really disappoints me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Clarity and performance excels
customer_reviews.text: Having owned a Sennheiser headset before I was still pleased at the improved quality and performance of this unit when connected to my TV Clarity was very important and I was not disappointed. The new technical options were also very much appreciated
customer_reviews.author: Arthur H. Ziegler

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as RS180
customer_reviews.text: Had RS 180s for almost 2 years, they broke so I decided to upgrade to the 220s in December 2013. Right away I realized that the range was not nearly as good as the 180s, then today the right side of the headphones have no sound. Sending in to get them repaired but I would not recommend them, if you want good headphones get the 180s and save a few hundred bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I'd rather trip over wires
customer_reviews.text: I had my cable snag for the last time so I bought into this, seeing the claims from sennheiser that it sounds similar to the 600's. The button placement is terrible, you'll hit the wrong buttons, the thing times out if your sound isn't on, so you'll have to take them off to locate the button and hold it, the Power-On LED indicator is just under where your thumb would press and it requires a timed "hold" to get them on. After having owned it for a while the thing just randomly turns off while I'm listening to music. Certainly not the quality of the 600's, I'm coming from the 555's.
customer_reviews.author: Isabell Medina

customer_reviews.title: Great item!
customer_reviews.text: Pricey, yes, but worth every dollar. Absolutely the best sound in a headphone that these ears have ever heard, hands down. I'm sure that you could get somewhat comparable performance by trading down to a less expensive brand, but you would certainly be compromising quality for price. If you are interested in absolutely the best performance in your purchase, you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: chesley_dog

customer_reviews.title: My first wireless headphone
customer_reviews.text: Well it's good headphone no drop out signals clear sound for a small room with alot of things you would think it well interfare the signals but no single drop out The bad thing about it is it's not loud enough whith noisy enviroment it lack bass but it okay for watching tv at night and apple tv you can connect it so easy with the optical wires and no surround i think it's good for a late tv watching
customer_reviews.author: bader mansour

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser's Top Notch Wireless Lossless Headphones
customer_reviews.text: The RS220 is expandable from one single base station to encompass up to four RS220 headsets for simultaneous listening to the same audio feed. This is a purely lossless transmission and the sound quality for concerts are truly amazing...with an extremely wide soundstage, upper clarity & deep rich base that holds its own (exceptionally solid double bass sounds). It has the ability to fee in audio from multiple feeds including an impressive optical input with passthrough. Its the ultimate Portable headset to get.
customer_reviews.author: Audiophiler

customer_reviews.title: Work well. Reliable. Decent sound
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these. One in my office, one in the beedroom and one in my exercise room. All function perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: kr

customer_reviews.title: I love RS220 headphone
customer_reviews.text: The headphone is almost perfect for me. The sound is perfect for me. It's comfort to wear it. The only problem is the coverage of the transmitter. It's perfect if you just stay in the range.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Z.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Sound
customer_reviews.text: These ear phones deliver fantastic sound that is sharp and clear. I would recommend them for anyone wanting excellent sound
customer_reviews.author: Ray Goldstein

customer_reviews.title: The comfort is not even close to Bose. I ...
customer_reviews.text: The comfort is not even close to Bose. I can clearly hear what my wife is listening to from 5 feet away. The transmitter is always turning itself off. They are for sale.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Downing

customer_reviews.title: Bad Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Range is only 15 ft. no wonder they discontinued them.
customer_reviews.author: greg treleaven

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: If your wife or significant other keeps telling you to turn the tv down at night. But you still want your surround sound this is the way to go
customer_reviews.author: The G man

customer_reviews.title: Best of the Best
customer_reviews.text: All the reviews, pro and con, were true and I'm very pleased with this purchase. Need/want headphones? Buy the best!
customer_reviews.author: John W Hale

customer_reviews.title: Not what it crack up to be
customer_reviews.text: Wow... i have high hope when purchased this headphone.. what a disappointment.. My brother cheaper Corsair gamer headphone sound 10 times better than this.
customer_reviews.author: S Ton

product_meta.title: Sennheiser RS 220 Headphone - Black (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description: Enjoy a new level of audiophile listening with the digital wireless RS 220. Comprising of an open, circum-aural headphone anda transmitter, this digital wireless headphone system delivers an uncompressed sound performance equaling those of high-end wired headphones. Shipping dimensions : 6.3 x 8.3 x 12 in
feature_bullets: Transmitter features digital and analog inputs
Power on/off, balance control and volume control integrated on headphone
Ergonomic and adjustable headband for an excellent and secure fit
Rechargeable integrated batteries with multi-purpose transmitter - Also functions as an easy-charge‘ cradle and docking station

specifications.Customer Reviews: 2.8 out of 5 stars83 ratings2.8 out of 5 stars
